nodes.text: A bartender worked in an establishment on the moon Nar Shaddaa during the Imperial Era. The bounty hunter Deva Lompop visited the bar while attempting to track down the hunter Boba Fett, who was in possession of the carbonite matrix containing the frozen Han Solo. When asked about Fett, the bartender declined having seen him. Lompop later returned to the establishment in order to extract information from Doc Ragon, who had stabilized the carbonite matrix for Fett. The bounty hunter made an agreement with the bartender, providing payment after a drunken Ragon told her about Solo.

During the Imperial Era, the bartender worked in a bar on the moon Nar Shaddaa. When the bounty hunter Deva Lompop visited Nar Shaddaa in search of fellow hunter Boba Fett, who had been waylaid on his journey to bring the carbonite-frozen body of Han Solo to the crime lord Jabba the Hutt, Lompop entered the bartender's establishment to ask about Fett. The bartender, while wiping down the surface of the bar, claimed not to have seen Fett, and the bounty hunter moved on.

Lompop soon returned, however, to acquire information from the Besalisk Doc Ragon, who Fett had previously visited to stabilize the carbonite matrix containing Solo. Having made a deal with the bartender, Lompop ensured that the Besalisk became drunk, revealing the details of Solo's status and location. After receiving sufficient information, Lompop incapacitated Ragon by pouring a substance into his drink. As per their agreement, the bounty hunter proceeded to pay the bartender, who questioned if Lompop was sure that Ragon was not dead. Lompop assured the bartender that the Besalisk was alive, but that he would wish he were dead once he had awoken.

The bartender was willing to make an agreement with Lompop that involved her incapacitating Ragon, one of the establishment's clients, but inquired whether he was alive after being paid. Possessing short black hair tied in a knot as well as facial hair of the same color, the bartender had yellow eyes as well as brown skin and fur.
The bartender wore a green vest, light gray pants, and a brown belt. The individual also possessed an earring and a necklace, and wore pink gloves.

Featuring in the comic War of the Bounty Hunters – Jabba the Hutt 1, written by Justina Ireland and published by Marvel Comics on July 21, 2021, the bartender appeared in a sequence illustrated by Ibraim Roberson.
